alert.note: Alert for McIntosh (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 27 at 7:51PM EDT until April 27 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Georgia, including the following county, McIntosh. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 748 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported that Highway 17 near Darien was flooded with a few stalled vehicles due heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing. - A cluster of thunderstorms continues to move across McIntosh County, producing torrential rainfall. A USGS rain gauge near Meridian measured almost 2 inches of rain in just over an hour. Radar rainfall estimates across the southern portion of the county suggest that 2-4 inches of rain has fallen. Roadway flooding is expected across the southern portion of the county, including in and around Darien, through the late evening hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Darien, Ridgeville, Carnigan, Meridian, Wolf Island, Valona, Sapelo Island, Little Saint Simons Island, Blackbeard Island, Ashintilly, Ardick and Raccoon Bluff.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 1-888-383-2024 or email your reports to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
